data.title: ASCR Workshop on Quantum Computing for Science (Technical Report)
data.meta_description: The U.S. Department of Energy's Office of Scientific and Technical Information
data.text:
@article{osti_1194404,

title = {ASCR Workshop on Quantum Computing for Science},

author = {Aspuru-Guzik, Alan and Van Dam, Wim and Farhi, Edward and Gaitan, Frank and Humble, Travis and Jordan, Stephen and Landahl, Andrew J and Love, Peter and Lucas, Robert and Preskill, John and Muller, Richard P. and Svore, Krysta and Wiebe, Nathan and Williams, Carl},

abstractNote = {This report details the findings of the DOE ASCR Workshop on Quantum Computing for Science that was organized to assess the viability of quantum computing technologies to meet the computational requirements of the DOE’s science and energy mission, and to identify the potential impact of quantum technologies. The workshop was held on February 17-18, 2015, in Bethesda, MD, to solicit input from members of the quantum computing community. The workshop considered models of quantum computation and programming environments, physical science applications relevant to DOE's science mission as well as quantum simulation, and applied mathematics topics including potential quantum algorithms for linear algebra, graph theory, and machine learning. This report summarizes these perspectives into an outlook on the opportunities for quantum computing to impact problems relevant to the DOE’s mission as well as the additional research required to bring quantum computing to the point where it can have such impact.},

doi = {10.2172/1194404},

url = {https://www.osti.gov/biblio/1194404}, journal = {},

number = ,

volume = ,

place = {United States},

year = {Mon Jun 01 00:00:00 EDT 2015},

month = {Mon Jun 01 00:00:00 EDT 2015}

}
